intro: Erigeron mimegletes, commonly known as the whiteleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Its white to pale blue flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Erigeron mimegletes is also known for its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in harsh, arid conditions.
